Name: Andrew D
Title: A cultural orientation
Review: Shilparamam is suprisingly lovely. I thought it would be a tacky tourist trap, but it is actually quite insightful.When you enter, there is a bazaar where arts and crafts from all around India are sold. For me, the highlight is the Handicraft Museum where you can learn about the crafts from different parts of India. The Bird Park, while a small area, does surprisingly exhibits interesting bird species! The Sculpture Park is another must-visit, and there is also a nice Cultural Show at the amphitheatre in the evening.

Name: stevebintley
Title: Great spot in an evening
Review: It might feel rather touristy at first but this is a great place to visit and is more than just stalls of mass produced goods. There’s entertainment on a large stage, some truly handmade crafts if you look close enough and plenty to admire with the statues and small museum in the centre. The colours are fantastic and none of the sellers were overly pushy, but remember to haggle if you do end up buying anything! A must visit when in the city!

Name: aruna
Title: Thiefs at Shilparamam parking lot
Review: Parking lot has many thief, they will take your away if you leave handbags and money in cars. Don't keep hand bangs or any luggage in shilparamam parking lot, its not safe place to park vehicle, they will charge 30rs for parking but will not care about your car.

Name: Arvind Kumar Yerram
Title: Wonderful. Must visit
Review: A beautiful ethnic crafts village. Crafts & artefacts are all available at very reasonable prices. Ample parking spaces. Paddle Boating available inside. Quite a good number of photo ops moments. Best place in Hyderabad for genuine and authentic crafts items for moments and gifts.  We can easily spend an entire evening here looking at the crafts are relaxing on the water side or in the greenery. Calm and serene. Must visit to carry some memories and memorabilia. Most of the crafts here are hand crafted.

Name: A N C NATARAJAN
Title: For Few Good Clicks and Handicrafts
Review: Recreation of Villages makes this place a must visit. They have tried to build all that you would remember if villages - bullock carts, mud houses, canals, lake, waterfalls etc  Sell a lot of handicraft articles. Better Bargain well. We grabbed a clay vessel out of the plethora of earthenware put for sale. Plenty of shops for home decor but we were more convinced with the door hangers sold at the entrance/exit. The best takeaway was the potrait of my 20 months old son, surprised that he cooperation for 2 minutes and went spellbound that the artist completed the picture within 5 mins.Covid restrictions not followed. No social distancing.

Name: Veer2468
Title: Must visit when in Hyderabad
Review: This is definitely a must visit place in Hyderabad. The entry tickets are a little pricey. The stuffs are ethnic. However lot of bargaining needs to be done.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Shilparamam
Review: Shilparamam has a conclave of handicraft sellers from India. Do not forget to bargain while shopping here.

Name: Vikas Singh
Title: Must visit
Review: Plan to spend at least four-five hours at this place. There is so much to see. There are three museums inside the complex- Handicraft museum, Leather Puppet museum and Village museum. There is open air sculpture park. There are nice walkaways and a small lake inside the complex. And you have shops selling variety of handicraft items. But bargain hard. Most of the stuff you can get at 50% of the quoted rate. There is also a nice food court where you can get ethnic food. Entrance fee is Rs.60. Normal digital cameras are allowed but if you have one with adjustable or long lens then the fee is Rs.500. There is ample parking space.

Name: N.H. Vijayaraghavan
Title: Handicrafts Heaven.
Review: A must vist place for handicrafts items, the rates are very reasonable. Purchased sarees and dresses. beautiful garden,

Name: Jo-Ann
Title: Crafts haven
Review: Huge area to walk around. Entrance fee is 50 Rupees. Plenty of stalls that sell scarfs, throws, silk, pearls, crafts, toys, jewellery. Plenty to see and shop. Shopkeepers are quite pushy. If you need to buy, do bargain. The village museum is on this grounds.

Name: Neelam_Macwan
Title: Shopping
Review: The place was on a list for a while, so decided to go there on a Saturday. It's venture by the state government to promote art and culture not only of Telangana but alos of other states. The place has 2-3 galleries and many stalls where one can buy traditional clothes, jewellery and decor items mainly. Also, it accommodates an amphitheater where there was a Bharatnatyam performance going on. It is extremely clean and very well maintained. I feel it is a smaller version of Nampally Exhibition. A must visit place in Hyderabad.

Name: Jay Pradhan
Title: Traditional Handicrafts Village
Review: Shilparamam is a traditional handicrafts village. The entry fee per adult is INR 50. I found a lot of traditional toys, sarees, ornaments & clothes here. They also have handmade purses, cup sets & stone idols. They organise a traditional dance in the evening, it was quite delightful to watch. All the prices will be high and one has to bargain to get a decent price. Overall a good place to venture into old traditional handicraft tour.

Name: Raji
Title: Shilparamam Hyderabad
Review: Nice place showing Indian cultures and traditions for the people. Must visit place in Hyderabad . You can get many more Indian jewelleries here

Name: misskark7
Title: traditional arts & culture
Review: traditional articles and ornaments clothing are all good and also food is great . and the entry fee is minimum so affordable for everyone. overall vistible with family friends colleagues relatives all....

Name: jainms
Title: Handcrafts village
Review: The culture and heritage of handcrafts. Family outing with kids is enjoyable here as they have some evening cultural programs too.

Name: yesarar
Title: Heritage displayed.
Review: Nice place to spend half day, a view of heritage and lots of shopping of handicrafts. Nice bargains and quality items.

Name: Kinggops
Title: Shilparamam - A Mini Dilli Haat !
Review: This place is a mini dilli haat.You get handicrafts,footwear & clothes from a few states. Definitely not as big as the one in Delhi & not as well represented by all states of our country. Bargaining -  20 to 30% is a must. A lady can easiy spend 2 to 3 hours here. Men & Kids may find it boring. A couple of small eateries catering for fast food is available inside. Just opposite across the road a good vegetarian restauran 'Chutneys ' is there if you want an elaborate meal. It is advisable to visit in the evening to avoid the Hyderabad Heat.

Name: BRKanth
Title: Weekend evening hangout place
Review: This is at the heart of the IT hub, hitech city and place to visit with family during the week ends and especially during festivals. Could see night bazar and enough options for food.

Name: NIL_MODI
Title: Good place
Review: Shilparamam is near to hi tech city so you need transportation to reach there. Its arts and craft village. It presents shopping of art and craft items, some entertainment like cart riding. overall you will feel village life experience. spreaded across wide areas.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Must visit this place if you love Art and Handicrafts
Review: I have been to this place several times before. Every time you visit here it feels so nice and your heart wakes your skills that were sleeping for a while internally. You feel like you must spend some time on your hobbies that improve your creativity.One more reason is you can buy lot of useful things that are hand made, starting from foot wear, hand printed clothes, decorative items, statues and what not everything under one roof. You can find the same things in exhibition also. But here there is some special reason I found only after I visited there.Go there when you have liesure time. Happy Shopping and enjoy the visit.

Name: Sivakumar
Title: Multiple attraction within
Review: You see the shilpakalavedika next to it where audio launches and other cultural events happens. And Art & craft village where you get items like clothes, jute bags, flower vases all hand made by villagers. And a park with lot of space/boating, a place to capture nice pics. But the entry fee for adult is 50 and kid is 30.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: Place for audio functions
Review: This place is mainly for big audio functions and school functions to be done and is located in hitech city which is great to viisst

Name: Usha65
Title: Replica of Andhra culture
Review: A nice place to go and shop for ethnic articles , dresses etc. The shops are housed in huts which and other constructions replicate the Andhra village culture. The boat ride in the lake inside, the small open air theater that hosts cultural performances are other attractions.

Name: Mandira P
Title: Heritage of India
Review: Stalls from different states showcasing their handicrafts is simply awesome, prices can be bargained, there is small food court for snakcs, lawns for kids to play, complete family outing

Name: nik c
Title: Great little market for handicrafts
Review: Shilparamam is a great market in Hitec City where you can buy from a huge range of Indian handicafts.   There is also a food court as well as lovely gardens with a paddle boat ride for kids on the lake.   A great place to spend a couple of hours.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: nice place
Review: Nice craft village which gives us various art options and also some tasty food and snacks inside.Easily accessible via road

Name: Suresh1976
Title: Nice Place to visit with family and friends
Review: Shilparamam is a nice art gallery where you can find many handicrafts stalls selling good products which is really worth. You will find some ethnic wear stalls also. You will find good handmade bedsheets, blankets stall also.The place is nicely maintained. There is an entrance fees. You will find few food stalls inside it selling dosas, chats and other items.we really had a nice time.

Name: Rajkiran Mahato
Title: Spicy chaat and Mouth watering snacks
Review: Good place for handicrafts shopping and hangouts and you can also find ethnic wear at a reasonable price and the food stalls for spicy delicacies are awesome

Name: Daniel T
Title: Visit here to know more about Indian culture
Review: This is a nice cultural place where many artisans display & sell their art works. You'll be surprised with the quality of art here. Most of the items are unique, something which you won't find in regular markets.Place can be visited with young kids.

Name: gabrial03330
Title: Good place to see AP's culture
Review: Shilparam is one of the famous places in hyd to visit where we can look back the history and culture of the place. Hand crafted  and some creative items are exhibiting there so if we preferred to buy we can buy better price if you you know how to negotiate better 😉

Name: Venkataraman M
Title: Not worth it!
Review: During the planning of our trip to Hyderabad, was told that this is one of the "must see" areas in the city. The closest comparision given was that of Dilli Haat, where I have been to and have enjoyed the experience there. I was therefore quite looking forward to the visit to this place. The place has an entry ticket of Rs. 50 for all adults (over the age of 10 years). The place was a complete disappointment and a waste of time. If you are coming here because you want to see the handicrafts and small scale/ cottage industry products, there are many other options available these days, where such exhibitions are held in nearly all the cities.There were very few traders there and the prices quoted by them were exorbitant. If you chose to walk away, you will get an immediate drop in price by as much as 33%. Clearly shows that the shopkeepers there have also become desperate.My recommendation is stay away and use your time more wisely in the city.

Name: koteswararao
Title: HEART OF CITY EXHIBITION
Review: This  is good place  in  city for diferent thpe Exhibitions  surounded by safevare cos Big marriage fiction hall top people meeting place

Name: plpalani
Title: Well maintained crafts and culture park
Review: This well maintained park has crafts expo, ethnic expo, village expo etc. There is a sand beach, mountain top, boating, etcThere are hundreds of small shops selling craft and textile goods.Well time spent

Name: ramakrishnabanoth3
Title: Village backdrop area.
Review: Well defined as well as built with good care of village locality.Nicely designed toys and sculptures of tribe and farming equipment.Feel good place to feel the village background.

Name: rockzzM77
Title: Fantastic place
Review: Must go this place whenever you are in Hyderabad, fantastic park, this is the theme park, maintained very nicely.

Name: Dipak Roy
Title: Must visit when Hyderabad
Review: It is in Hiteck city of Hyderabad.One can spent half day here. A museum show casing village life is well maintain. There is a open air theater and park.Good number of stalls are available for shopping handicrafts.

Name: Sandeep57
Title: A refreshing place
Review: Amazing place , it looks that Rocks speak and you can talk to them . A village scene created there is amazing , you feel like part of the village

Name: mail2mathews96
Title: Shilparamam
Review: Shilparamam is one of the best place to roam where we can see lots of shopping products place is well maintained and clean

Name: Bruce M
Title: Great shopping for souvenirs and gifts
Review: This is by far the best open air shopping area in Hyderabad. 50INR admission is worth it. Area is clean and well maintained. Shopping is from individually licensed shopkeepers with specific stalls assigned. Be prepared to bargain anywhere from 25-60% in the price of items. The amount to be bargained depends on the uniqueness of the item and amount of hand work required.  For instance, the pashmina comes in a wide array of quality and print and many shops have it, bargain at least 50%.  Hand painted terra-cotta is much less coin and hand painted. Recommend coming in the evening when it’s cooler. Uber might be difficult during the rush hour.
